docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 28 Edward G. Miller Jr., United States Assistant Secretary of State, who is here for the inauguration of Uruguayan President Andres Martinez Trueba tomorrow, expressed deep concern this evening over the news from Buenos...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 28 Edward G. Miller Jr., United States Assistant Secretary of State, who is here for the inauguration of Uruguayan President Andres Martinez Trueba tomorrow, expressed deep concern this evening over the news from Buenos Aires of the attack on La Prensa workers.
docs.abstract: Asst Sec Miller on effects of Govt action on newspaper La Prensa

headline.main: Thuggery at La Prensa Disturbs Miller; He Fears Attack Has Hurt Good Relations

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKER Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES.Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 1 The Time correspondent here, Frank Shea, and Life photographer, Leonard McCombe, were released today a few minutes past noon, after having been in police custody for almost thirty-six hours.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 1 The Time correspondent here, Frank Shea, and Life photographer, Leonard McCombe, were released today a few minutes past noon, after having been in police custody for almost thirty-six hours.
docs.abstract: Shea and McCombe sentenced and pardoned immediately; Prensa pootographer T Gil jailed; Peronista press charges NY Times correspondent and other foreign newsmen connived with Prensa mgt to start trouble; mgt reptdly seeks return of plant; US Min Mallory conf with Miller; Amer Magazine Photographers Soc scores McCombe and Gil jailing, wire to US Amb Bunker

headline.main: TWO GET 'PARDONS' IN LA PRENSA CASE; American, British News Men Sentenced in Buenos Aires to Jail and Then Freed

byline.original: By VIRGINIA LEE WARREN Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1 Lester De Witt Mallory, United States Minister and charge d'affaires in Buenos Aires, flew here today in an Embassy plane to give Assistant Secretary of State Miller a briefing on events in the Argentine capital relating...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1 Lester De Witt Mallory, United States Minister and charge d'affaires in Buenos Aires, flew here today in an Embassy plane to give Assistant Secretary of State Miller a briefing on events in the Argentine capital relating to the closing of La Prensa.

headline.main: Miller and Mallory Confer; Photographers' Group Protests

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1 Andres Martinez Trueba today succeeded Luis Batlle Berres as President of Uruguay. The former head of the Central Bank took the oath before a joint session of Congress shortly before 4 P.M. Alfeo Brum was sworn in as Vice...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1 Andres Martinez Trueba today succeeded Luis Batlle Berres as President of Uruguay. The former head of the Central Bank took the oath before a joint session of Congress shortly before 4 P.M. Alfeo Brum was sworn in as Vice President a few minutes later. Both men will serve four years.

headline.main: New Uruguayan President Sworn; Reaffirms Ties to Democracies; Former Head of Central Bank Is Inducted Before Representatives of 40 Nations Pledges Maintenance of Liberties Protected by Law 40 Countries Represented
